result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Biagini

defendant.name: Biagini, Kimberly M
defendant.address: N1271 Maple Rd, Genoa City, WI 53128

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM (64-06)  Defendant Kimberly M Biagini in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

*AMENDMENT 8-2-2022 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.S.B. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 
TOTAL BOND COVERS 22CF384, 22CF62 & 22CT8

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.S.B. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Kimberly M Biagini in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Vivian TenHaken.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini. Called @ 3:39 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF384 and 4th status on 22CF62 and 22CT8. Record by Atty. Venema who goes over the charges in new file with the defendant, waives its reading, and asks that new file be set for preliminary hearing outside time limits.  Further request to have pending matters track to that date.
Victim is present in Court and asks for the no contact to be lifted in this matter as she needs defendant home to help her (mother is victim). State objects until standard procedures are completed as to lifting of no-contact. Court amends bond to no violent contact with the victim, and defendant to go downstairs to sign new bond.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Reddy after August 1, 2022.

Defendant Kimberly M Biagini in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini. Called @ 3:12 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 3rd status on 22CF62 and 22CT8. Record by Atty. Venema as to new referral coming from the State who has not made charging decision yet. Record by the State who confirms that new charges are coming and asks the Court to combine bonds. Court declines to combine bonds at this time and they will remain as ordered on each case. Discussion as to amending scheduling order. Court declines at this time to amend deadlines but will readdress. Court removes July 15th Court date and sets both matters out about 3 weeks. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kimberly M Biagini in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini. Called @ 3:46 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 2nd status on both files - 22CF62 & 22CT8. Record by Atty. Venema as to status and offer. He has received offer, but wants to speak with DA as to counter offer. Response by the Court who will give one more status. If matters do not resolve at next hearing, matters will be reassigned and set for trial before the assigned judge. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kimberly M Biagini not in court.  Attorney Brad Lochowicz for Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini. Defendant's ride fell through. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
with Exhibit #1 attached
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:19 PM (64-06) Defendant Kimberly M Biagini in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kimberly M Biagini. 
State called to the stand as a witness Alexander Heddle.
Alexander Heddle duly sworn and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness identified defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:20 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Venema.
2:22 PM- Redirect by ADA Herrmann.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann.
Attorney Venema objects to the bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds her over to stand trial on the charges. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Venema acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial reserved.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

3:37 PM - Defendant Kimberly M Biagini not in court, Attorney Kim appeared for Mackenzie Renner for Kimberly M Biagini not in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by Vivian TenHaken.
Court was scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing.
Attorney Kim made a record, Defendant's ride fell through and Attorney Renner has a conflict with the defendant and needs to withdraw and appoint another Public Defender.
ADA TenHaken made a record as to defendant not appearing at the last two hearings and is requesting a Warrant.
Court will authorize a warrant. TO BE STAYED UNTIL 04-04-2022 at 2PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:15pm Court in session

Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared in court for Kimberly M Biagini. ADA J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of WIsconsin. Deft does not appear. Atty Renner was going to be her ride to court today but Atty Renner had hearings that finished later than anticipated & she was not able to transport Deft. 

State is in agreement to reset.

3:20pm Court in recess
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Mackenzie Renner

2:04 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kimberly M Biagini not in court. Attorney Mackenzie Renner in appeared. Defendant having a mental health crisis. Defendant needs to be booked and printed. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF62 & 22CT8
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Kimberly M Biagini appeared, Vivien L. TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
